Posts.Content: jswir2 wrote: Hi all.  This is my first time posting on these boards.  I'm posting to hopefully get some information to help my mother-in-law who has Stage IV metastatic breast cancer.  She is ER/PR+, HER-.  Surgery on breast was summer 2010.  She was to start chemo about a year ago and they discovered she had a 1.5 cm tumor in her hip/back and .8mm tumor in her lung.  Biopsy confirmed it was metastatic from the breast.  1 year ago, she started on Arimidex.  At first, she had a good result.  The tumors shrank.  But she just had a repeat PET scan and they called to tell her that the lung tumor has remained the same, but the hip tumor appears to be a bit larger.  She has appt. w/oncologist on Tuesday.  I'm wondering what to expect at this stage?  What questions to ask?  What would be the typical next treatment?  (if there is anything "typical").  Any thoughts and suggestions would be greatly appreciated.  Thank you! Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2012 06:40PM jswir2 wrote: Thank you so much for a quick response.  I guess what I'm wondering is does this recent development mean the end is near or is it possible to continue to treat and switch it up so that she has some years ahead of her?  I know this is an impossible question for anyone to really answer.  I guess I'm wondering what the average is here.  Really, you'd look at my mother in law and think there was nothing wrong w/her.  She tolerated the Arimidex well and has been feeling good.  I just want her to be here for our kids for a long long time. I've been reading a few other posts and am also wondering if she's a good candidate for experimental treatments?  I see some people saying that if it has spread to too many places they're no longer a good candidate... Thanks again.
